de.tubs.cs.iti.krypto.chiffre
Class Cipher

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--de.tubs.cs.iti.krypto.chiffre.Cipher
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlockCipher
public abstract class Cipher
extends java.lang.Object

This is the (abstract) superclass to hold cipher-algorithms. Its descendants handle the actual encryption and decryption, and also the creation of keys and the cryptoanalysis.

Constructor Summary
Cipher()

encipher

public abstract void encipher(java.io.File cleartextFile,
                              java.io.File ciphertextFile)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Encrypt cleartext, reading from cleartextFile and writing to ciphertextFile.

Parameters:
cleartextFile - the file that contains the cleartext.
ciphertextFile - the file that is to hold the encoded text.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
CharconvertException - if some character couldn't be converted.

                       throws java.io.IOException
Decrypt ciphertext, reading from ciphertextFile and writing to cleartextFile.

Parameters:
cleartextFile - the file that is to hold the cleartext.
ciphertextFile - the file that contains the encoded text.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
CharconvertException - if some character couldn't be converted.

makeKey

public abstract void makeKey()
Create a new key.

breakCipher

public abstract void breakCipher(java.io.File cleartextFile,
                                 java.io.File ciphertextFile,
                                 de.tubs.cs.iti.krypto.chiffre.Tables tables)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 KryptoException
Find out the key and decode the ciphertext. Analyze contents of ciphertextFile and write the result into cleartextFile. Try to derive the key from this.

Parameters:
cleartextFile - the file that is to hold the decoded text.
ciphertextFile - the file that contains the encoded text.
tables - uni-, di- and trigraph tables that may be helpful in analyzing the ciphertext.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
KryptoException - if the ciphertext cannot be decoded for some reason.
